examples: Better ask teacher about.
I just about busted a gut.
The boss of the failed company is keeping schtum about his role in the disaster.
The plane holds about 300 passengers.
The plane holds about 300 passengers.
words.defineEn: used with a number to show that it is not exact
words.defineVi: được sử dụng với một số để chỉ ra rằng nó không chính xác

examples: The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
But that was a long time ago.
I had a brush with him a number of years ago.
He should have been given the boot years ago.
Until three years ago, I could have slept for England.
words.defineEn: used to refer to a time in the past, showing how much time has passed before the present moment
words.defineVi: dùng để chỉ một thời điểm trong quá khứ, cho thấy thời gian đã trôi qua bao lâu trước thời điểm hiện tại

examples: Grasp all, lose all.
After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
Every age has its book, after all.
After all, love will find a way.
After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
words.defineEn: to the full or complete degree
words.defineVi: đến mức độ đầy đủ hoặc hoàn thành

examples: You're not calling the shots anymore.
Creating new music isn't exactly on his front burner anymore.
John's elderly mother rarely left the house anymore, but when his car broke down and he needed a ride, suddenly she was up and out the door.
I layed down the law and now my wife doesn't cheat on me anymore.
I don't want to be just a cog in the machine anymore!
words.defineEn: no longer
words.defineVi: không còn

examples: Yet, for the moment anyway, the bankers have lost their Midas touch.
I went to college anyway, as a part-time student, paying my own way.
but i waved a dead chicken and corrected the spelling anyway.
Sarah knew that skipping classes would hurt her grades, but she did it anyway.
I know it's risky, but if I'm going to get in trouble anyway, I might as well be hanged for a sheep as a lamb.
words.defineEn: regardless; in spite of something
words.defineVi: bất kể; bất chấp điều gì đó

examples: Intellectually, this man and I are worlds apart.
They are worlds apart in their political views.
She cheated on her husband and broke her family apart.
They made a wish and pulled apart the wishbone, hoping for good luck.
My sister and I are very close now, but we were worlds apart growing up.
words.defineEn: distanced from one another by time or space
words.defineVi: cách xa nhau bởi thời gian hoặc không gian

examples: Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
He certainly earned his place in the sun.
Kramer has certainly won the respect of his peers.
I certainly learned my lesson about buying something from a stranger online.
America is certainly bigger than the sum of its parts.
words.defineEn: with no doubt
words.defineVi: không có nghi ngờ

examples: Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
He certainly earned his place in the sun.
Kramer has certainly won the respect of his peers.
I certainly learned my lesson about buying something from a stranger online.
America is certainly bigger than the sum of its parts.
words.defineEn: with no doubt
words.defineVi: không có nghi ngờ

examples: The leaves of Morus alba are commonly used as food.
Lime juice is commonly added to beverages for a refreshing twist.
Black-eyed peas are commonly used in stews, soups, salads, and traditional dishes.
Iceland moss is commonly used in traditional Scandinavian cuisine
Raw milk is commonly used in certain traditional desserts, like rice pudding and flan.
words.defineEn: used to say how frequent or usual something is
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói mức độ thường xuyên hoặc bình thường của một cái gì đó

examples: He had true knowledge about the subject and answered all the questions correctly.
I remember correctly.
Am I saying that correctly?
Did you guess correctly?
The American people perceive correctly that we are in an urgent moment.
words.defineEn: in a right way and without mistake
words.defineVi: một cách đúng đắn và không có sai lầm

examples: My best friend's pink hair definitely raised a few eyebrows at our very strict school.
I definitely felt the importance of the occasion.
You should definitely bake a brie with cranberry sauce.
Speaking that rudely to your teacher definitely crosses the line.
Going to the beach is definitely my scene.
words.defineEn: in a certain or definite way
words.defineVi: theo một cách nhất định hoặc xác định

examples: Double cream adds indulgence to creamy pasta sauces.
His parents did a double take when he came home with a tattoo.
The kitchen had a double oven, allowing for simultaneous baking of different dishes.
Take your hot beverages to the next level by adding a splash of double cream to them.
When the price of skiing doubled, tourists voted with their feet and just stopped going.
words.defineEn: to or at twice the extent or amount
words.defineVi: đến hoặc gấp đôi mức độ hoặc số lượng

examples: Each technology has its pros and cons.
The apple orchard typically yields a bountiful harvest each year.
Each chapter begins with a quotation.
A cure for lung cancer would save thousands of lives each year.
The company is healthily growing its revenue each year.
words.defineEn: used to consider every member of a group separately
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để xem xét từng thành viên của một nhóm riêng biệt

examples: The cleaning product contains stiff chemicals that effectively remove tough stains.
He focused on the meat and potatoes of his job, accomplishing tasks efficiently and effectively.
Sally decided to quit her job and publicly criticize her former employer, effectively burning her bridges with the company.
It helps me to focus on the most important parts of a story and communicate them effectively.
After a disagreement, the team is working to get back on the rails and collaborate effectively to achieve their shared goals.
words.defineEn: in a way that results in the desired outcome
words.defineVi: theo cách dẫn đến kết quả mong muốn

examples: Take enough supplies.
Alright I had enough.
Are you warm enough?
Oh yes, enough said.
Even a dog knows enough to come out of the rain, Charlie.
words.defineEn: to a degree or extent that is sufficient or necessary
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ hoặc mức độ đó là đủ hoặc cần thiết

examples: All members of the band equally share the band's profits.
They are all equally below the salt.
It seems clear that a compromise, half-way solution had equally been ruled out by Government, Opposition, economists, press, TV, Uncle Tom Cobleigh and all.
What he lacks in book knowledge he makes up with his street smarts and policing instincts, which often prove equally helpful to the investigation.
The CEO acknowledged that all men cannot be first, but that each employee played a crucial role in the success of the company, and that they were all valued equally.
words.defineEn: to the same amount or degree
words.defineVi: với cùng số lượng hoặc mức độ

examples: The guy couldn't even harm a flea.
Even the experts took the painting for a genuine Van Gogh.
Some of his paintings never even saw the light of day.
A warm bowl of minestrone soup is even more comforting with a sprinkle of grated Parmesan cheese.
Don't even bother.
words.defineEn: used to show that something is surprising or is not expected
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho thấy rằng một cái gì đó là đáng ngạc nhiên hoặc không được mong đợi

examples: His family comes first.
This software first saw the light of day back in 1993.
With the signing of the treaty, a powerful new European alliance first saw the light of day.
She dived head first into the water.
The horse took the first fence well.
words.defineEn: before anything or anyone else
words.defineVi: trước bất cứ điều gì hoặc bất cứ ai khác

examples: Save data frequently.
They frequently went to Manchester to go window shopping.
Lisa and Mark have been spotted together so frequently that everyone knows they're an item.
Tension began to build as they argued more frequently.
When he was away for prolonged periods on work, he would frequently write letters to her and write SWAK at the back of the envelope, to signify that it was sealed with a kiss.
words.defineEn: regularly and with short time in between
words.defineVi: thường xuyên và với thời gian ngắn ở giữa

examples: I fully understand the reason for your decision.
They are neither students nor fully qualified practitioners.
My uncle's parting words to me were that life is not separate from death, it only looks that way, and that I should live fully yet let go lightly when the time came to say goodbye.
I don't fully trust John to keep our plan a secret, so I think it best that we keep him in the dark for now.
Though people tried to help, they could never fully grasp the complexities of her circumstances, for only the wearer knows where the shoe pinches and where the most discomfort lies.
words.defineEn: to the largest degree
words.defineVi: ở mức độ lớn nhất

examples: After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
You hardly made a dent in your dinner.
There were hardly a few people in the audience.
Hardly anyone stands on ceremony.
These are hardly the bread-and-butter concerns of struggling farmers.
words.defineEn: close to none; almost not
words.defineVi: gần như không; hầu như không

examples: Mary's makeup was applied so heavily that it looked like she had a face that could stop a clock.
The company's decision to invest heavily in the new product was a kill or cure move.

The company that relies too heavily on a single product or service may be vulnerable to market changes or competition, demonstrating how the pitcher goes so often to the well that it is broken at last.
In a business environment, a playing field which is heavily regulated and favors established companies can make it challenging for new startups to compete and thrive.
Islamic narratives heavily influenced the perception of jinn and their characteristics.
words.defineEn: in large amounts or to a great degree
words.defineVi: với số lượng lớn hoặc ở mức độ lớn

examples: The Council of Ministers, however, is still putting a spanner in the works.
However, they quickly realized that their love and support for her shouldn't be affected by her sexual orientation.
However, with careful planning and sacrifices, she managed to make the trips of her dreams.
However, I did find Avery's reaction to catching him with his pants down to be pretty unrealistic.
However, creditors have better memory than debtors, and they will eventually come calling for what is owed to them.
words.defineEn: used to add a statement that contradicts what was just mentioned
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thêm một tuyên bố mâu thuẫn với những gì vừa được đề cập

examples: It's actually an incredibly good deal!
He invested wisely and became incredibly rich.
The Bartlett pear I bought from the farmers market was incredibly juicy.
The Persian melon I tried in Iran was incredibly juicy and sweet.
The basketball player is incredibly quick on his feet, able to outmaneuver anyone on the court.
words.defineEn: extremely or to a great degree
words.defineVi: cực kỳ hoặc đến một mức độ tuyệt vời

examples: A fool at forty is a fool indeed.
This was a red-letter day indeed.
Success has many fathers, failure is an orphan, indeed.
It takes a thief to catch a thief indeed.
It seems to me that the press and some others are indeed using the measure to dig up dirt on the government.
words.defineEn: used to emphasize or confirm a statement
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh hoặc xác nhận một tuyên bố

examples: John will follow the path of least resistance.
A CEO may receive helpful suggestions from the least experienced employee, as even a mouse may help a lion.
They would rather take the line of least resistance than become involved in arguments.
The success of a business is only as great as the least successful department within it, as a chain is only as strong as its weakest link.
He carefully selected the least overripe avocados from the pile.
words.defineEn: to the smallest degree or extent
words.defineVi: đến mức độ hoặc mức độ nhỏ nhất

examples: ur company mainly produces goods for export.
The smell was mainly decomposing flesh.
The cases on the Till Act list mainly cover the 1950s and 60s.
The city is projecting a fifteen point six billion dollar deficit for fiscal year twenty twenty two for twenty four, mainly due to a decline in property tax collections.
Mainly, he just picked up static from thunderstorms.
words.defineEn: chiefly or in most cases
words.defineVi: chủ yếu hoặc trong hầu hết các trường hợp

examples: Mostly, the Chinese government views renewable energy as a major economic opportunity.
And petrochemicals mostly means plastic.
Mostly making war.
The exams mostly tested memorization and recitation from the important government and Confucian texts.
But stone carvings mostly concern gods and wars.
words.defineEn: for the most part; mainly
words.defineVi: hầu hết; chủ yếu

examples: Working with sheep comes naturally to sheepdogs.
Naturally, it allowed him to feather his nest over the years.
Some people are just naturally good at math, and no amount of practice can change that because it's a case of born, not made.
The coach believed that nature passes nurture, and that some athletes are just naturally more talented than others, regardless of their training and practice.
Many people assume that men are naturally better at sports, but time and time again, female athletes have proven that the gray mare is the better horse, often outperforming their male counterparts.
words.defineEn: as is expected
words.defineVi: như mong đợi

examples: I absolutely love your shoes.
The cranberry pie at the bakery is absolutely delicious, especially with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Jenny is absolutely cheesed off with her job.
He was said to be absolutely shattered after losing his job.
Those of you with clear consciences have absolutely nothing to fear.
words.defineEn: used to show complete agreement
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để hiển thị hoàn toàn đồng ý
